required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating Quality of Life of AF Patients Following a Bleed
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating Quality of Life of AF Patients Following a Bleed

brief_summary.textblock: EQUAL-AF is an observational feasibility study which will determine if there is a long-term effect of bleeding for patients diagnosed with AF, who are taking anticoagulants. The investigators will use three validated questionnaires/PROMs (AFEQT, EQ5D-3L, and PACT-Q) to gather data from a patient perspective. Patients will complete all questionnaires no more than 4 weeks following a bleed and a second time 3 months later. As this study tests feasibility, progression criteria will apply. The primary objective is to assess recruitment success to ensure that the patient population is accessible and willing to engage with the research team. Additionally, the investigators will look to identify the need for a specific bleeding PROM which will assess long-term quality of life impact for patients experiencing bleeds while anticoagulated.

primary_outcome.measure: Test the feasibility of identifying and recruiting patients with both minor and major bleeds as a result of anticoagulant treatment for AF associated events
primary_outcome.description: Recruitment of a minimum of 50 eligible patients onto the study

primary_outcome.measure: Patient quality of life in both primary and secondary care settings as measured by EQ-5D-5L score
primary_outcome.description: Patient quality of life in both primary and secondary care settings as measured by EQ-5D-

primary_outcome.measure: Patient quality of life in both primary and secondary care settings as measured by EQ-5D-5L score
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months following first completion of study survey
primary_outcome.description: Patient quality of life in both primary and secondary care settings as measured by EQ-5D-

primary_outcome.description: Patient quality of life in both primary and secondary care settings as measured by Atrial

secondary_outcome.measure: Observe differences in QoL by type of bleed as measured by clinical classification of minor and major bleeds using BARC scale.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One data point at 4 weeks using the validated questionnaires and a follow-up at 3 months for each patient.
secondary_outcome.description: A small number of additional relevant questions will be asked of the patient, regarding when the bleed occurred, the nature of the bleed and their current treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Identifying the treatment received and the nature of the bleed experienced by capturing type of anticoagulant combined with bleed details from each participant.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One data point at 4 weeks using the validated questionnaires and a follow-up at 3 months for each patient.
secondary_outcome.description: Identifying the treatment received and the nature of the bleed experienced by capturing

secondary_outcome.measure: Insight into issues experienced with bleeding from participant perspective as measured by structured qualitative interviews.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Following completion of both 4 week and 3 month timepoint.
secondary_outcome.description: Insight into issues experienced with bleeding from participant perspective as measured by structured qualitative interviews.

secondary_outcome.measure: Appropriateness of three chosen PROMs (EQ5D, AFEQT and PACT-Q, part 2) in capturing QoL data for patients who have experienced a bleed while anticoagulated as measured by responses to suitability questions within the participant survey.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One data point at 4 weeks using the validated questionnaires and a follow-up at 3 months for each patient.
secondary_outcome.description: Additional questions to evaluate appropriateness of chosen PROMs in capturing Quality of Life issues for patients diagnosed with AF who are anticoagulated

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients (â‰¥18) who have AF are actively prescribed oral anticoagulant therapies (OATs) and have recently experienced bleeds, up to a maximum of 4 weeks prior to enrolment. No upper age limit will be applied, but patients must match all other inclusion/exclusion criteria. Patients will be selected from the Swansea area only, who attend/have attended either anticoagulation clinics within the Swansea City Health Cluster, Morriston emergency department or have been admitted to wards at Morriston Hospital due to a bleed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Adult patients (>= 18 years old)
- Patients who can understand all study information and literature to provide fully informed consent
- Atrial fibrillation (AF) as the primary diagnosis
- Having a major or minor bleed up to a maximum of 30 days prior to point of enrolment
- Receiving oral anticoagulation therapy for AF
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women
- Patients with active cancer
- Patients unable to consent for themselves
- Patient on concomitant antiplatelet therapy
